Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: A simple description of the layout. This name has no effect on the display of the ads. Typically you would include the recommended dimensions of the ad and the number of rows and columns to help content managers.

Field.Name: rowcnt
Field.Caption: Rows
Field.HelpDefault: The number of rows intended for this layout.

Field.Name: columncnt
Field.Caption: Columns
Field.HelpDefault: The number of columns intended for this layout.

Field.Name: pxcolumnspace
Field.Caption: Space Between Columns (px)
Field.HelpDefault: The integer number of pixels required between each ad in the same row.

Field.Name: pxrowspace
Field.Caption: Space Between Rows (px)
Field.HelpDefault: The integer number of pixels required between each row of ads.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this category as it will appear on the newsletter.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this rule. It is not necessary but may be helpful to locate this rule in a list of rules.

Field.Name: newsletterissueid
Field.Caption: Issue
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this issue.

Field.Name: categoryid
Field.Caption: Category
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this category.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this issue. For instance, if this is the January issue of your Events newsletter, this name field might be January.

Field.Name: newsletterid
Field.Caption: Newsletter
Field.HelpDefault: This is the newsletter that this issue is associated with. For instance, if this is the January issue of the Events newsletter, you would select Events in this list.

Field.Name: sponsor
Field.Caption: Cover Sponsor
Field.HelpDefault: If the template includes the sponsor tag on the cover, this field will be put in the tag.

Field.Name: publishdate
Field.Caption: Publish Date
Field.HelpDefault: When set, this issue will not be visible on the public site until this date has passed. You might use this field when creating a new issue of the newsletter. Set it to a future date when you want to show this issue. While you are editing, you will still be able to see unpublished issues using the admin controls under the newsletter.

Field.Name: cover
Field.Caption: Cover
Field.HelpDefault: This is the cover copy for the newsletter. This copy will display at the top of the page when someone views the main page of the newsletter. This copy is not shown when displaying individual stories.

Field.Name: overview
Field.Caption: Overview for Archive Page
Field.HelpDefault: The Overview copy is a brief version of the cover copy, used when displaying a list of issues. For instance, this is displayed in the archive view.

Field.Name: bannerlayoutid
Field.Caption: Layout
Field.HelpDefault: Select the layout to determine the number of rows and columns for the ad banner presentation. Leave this blank to prevent ad banners.

Field.Name: adbanner0
Field.Caption: Banner 1
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink0
Field.Caption: Banner 1 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: adbanner1
Field.Caption: Banner 2
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink1
Field.Caption: Banner 2 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: adbanner2
Field.Caption: Banner 3
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink2
Field.Caption: Banner 3 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: adbanner3
Field.Caption: Banner 4
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink3
Field.Caption: Banner 4 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: adbanner4
Field.Caption: Banner 5
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink4
Field.Caption: Banner 5 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: adbanner5
Field.Caption: Banner 6
Field.HelpDefault: A banner image matching the Ad Banner Layout selected.

Field.Name: adbannerlink5
Field.Caption: Banner 6 Link
Field.HelpDefault: The url where the user will be sent if they click on the ad banner.

Field.Name: active
Field.Caption: Active
Field.HelpDefault: Mark inactive to disable the view of this issue

Field.Name: sortorder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: Use this field to set a sort order for the newsletter issues. If this field is blank the issues will be sorted by publish date.

Field.Name: tagline
Field.Caption: Cover Tagline
Field.HelpDefault: If the template includes the tagline tag on the cover, this field will be put in the tag. If this field is empty, the element with class newsletterTagLineRow will be removed.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: This is the name of your story. It will also be used as the headline.

Field.Name: overview
Field.Caption: Cover Overview
Field.HelpDefault: This is the overview for this story. It is displayed on the newsletter cover under the link to the story. This copy will also be used in the RSS feed for the newsletter.

Field.Name: coverinfographicthumbnail
Field.Caption: Cover Infographic Thumbnail
Field.HelpDefault: This story will include a this infographic thumbnail on both the cover and the full story. If a Infographic is also included (below), the cover and the full story page will link to the infographic (open in new tab).

Field.Name: coverinfographic
Field.Caption: Cover Infographic (req. thumbnail)
Field.HelpDefault: If provided, a link will be created for the infographic to open in new tab. If a thumbnail is provided, the thumbnail will be linked.

Field.Name: coverinfographicurl
Field.Caption: Cover Infographic URL (alt)
Field.HelpDefault: If this field is included and no Cover Infographic is provided, the thumbnail will be linked to this URL.

Field.Name: body
Field.Caption: Full Story
Field.HelpDefault: This is the main body of the story. It is included on the story's page, linked from front page and the In This Issue navigation

Field.Name: newsletterid
Field.Caption: Issue
Field.HelpDefault: This is the issue in which this story appears.

Field.Name: categoryid
Field.Caption: Category
Field.HelpDefault: Use optional categories to separate your stories into groups.

Field.Name: active
Field.Caption: Active
Field.HelpDefault: Mark this story inactive will prevent it from displaying in the issue.

Field.Name: sortorder
Field.Caption: Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: This field determines the order which stories will be displayed on the cover page of the issue, and in the issue navigation.

Field.Name: allowprinterpage
Field.Caption: Allow Printer Page
Field.HelpDefault: Checking this box enables a print link at the top of the story.

Field.Name: allowemailpage
Field.Caption: Allow Email Page
Field.HelpDefault: Checking this box enables an email link at the top of the story.

Field.Name: allowreadmore
Field.Caption: Allow Read More
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the cover of the newsletter will display the overview copy and include a read-more link to the page with the whole story.

Field.Name: rssfeeds
Field.Caption: RSS Feeds
Field.ManyToManyRuleContent: RSS Feed Newsletter Issue Page Rules
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) Select the RSS feed(s) you would like this story to be included on. Enter each of the values below for the feed, or leave them blank and they will be automatically populated the first time this story is read on the website.

Field.Name: rsstitle
Field.Caption: Title
Field.HelpDefault: The main title used for the RSS feed story. This is similar to the story name. Leave it blank and it will be automatically populated the first time the story is read on the website.

Field.Name: rssdescription
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: The description of the RSS feed story. This is similar to the story overview. Leave it blank and it will be automatically populated the first time the story is read on the website.

Field.Name: rssdatepublish
Field.Caption: Date Publish
Field.HelpDefault: This is the date this story will become available on the RSS Feed. Since this date is independant of the story's issue publich date, you should take care not to make this available in the RSS feed if the link points to a story that is not yet published.

Field.Name: rrssdateexpire
Field.Caption: Date Expires
Field.HelpDefault: After this date the story will no longer be available on the RSS feed.

Field.Name: rsslink
Field.Caption: RSS Link Override
Field.HelpDefault: Enter the link which the RSS feed will use when someone clicks on the Title. This should take them to the story within the site. Leave it blank and it will be automatically populated the first time the story is read on the website.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this rule. It is not required but helpful if you later need to locate this rule in a list.

Field.Name: groupid
Field.Caption: Group
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this group.

Field.Name: newsletterpageid
Field.Caption: Story
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this story.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name you use for this template. This name will not be visible to people who see your newsletter.

Field.Name: template
Field.Caption: Template
Field.HelpDefault: This is the newsletter template. Since newsletters can generate a group email, it is recommended that you include all styles needed inlinem, and NOT reference styles from the site stylesheet.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this newsletter. For instance, Current News, or Industry News. Each issue will have it's own name, such as January Edition.

Field.Name: templateid
Field.Caption: Template
Field.HelpDefault: Select the template for this newsletter. The template is the html document that your newsletter stories will be added to.

Field.Name: emailtemplateid
Field.Caption: Email Template (optional)
Field.HelpDefault: If you have a different template for email, select it here. If None, then the standard Newsletter template will be used for email as well.

Field.Name: mastheadfilename
Field.Caption: Masthead Image
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. If your template(s) include an html element with a class newsHeaderMasthead, an html img tag will be inserted into that element. The default template uses and image 600px wide x 246px tall.

Field.Name: footerfilename
Field.Caption: Footer Image
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. If your template(s) include an html element like a div with a class newsFooter, an html img tag will be inserted into that element. The default template uses and image 600px wide x 169px tall.

Field.Name: searchresultsperpage
Field.Caption: Search Results per Page
Field.HelpDefault: The number of archive issues to display in the archive issue list.

Field.Name: archiveissuestodisplay
Field.Caption: Archive Issues To Display
Field.HelpDefault: The number of archive issues to display in the archive issue list.

Field.Name: blockarchivesearchform
Field.Caption: Block Archive Search Form
Field.HelpDefault: Mark inactive to disable the view of this issue

Field.Name: padtop
Field.Caption: Top Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padright
Field.Caption: Right Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padbottom
Field.Caption: Bottom Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padleft
Field.Caption: Left Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: backgroundimagefilename
Field.Caption: Background Image
Field.HelpDefault: Add a background image to the design block. It will be reduced in size to cover the entire background.

Field.Name: asfullbleed
Field.Caption: Add Container Margin for Full Bleed template
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, this design block should be used within a container. When checked, the block is expected to span the full width of the screen and may create its own container.

Field.Name: styleheight
Field.Caption: Height (with units)
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Set a style height and the design block will be forced this this height. Include both the number and the units, like 500px or 20em.

Field.Name: themestyleid
Field.Caption: Block Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Select a css class selector to be added to the block's wrapper. Use this feature to customize the layout styles. To add a custom style, add the css class selector in the content 'Design Block Themes' and add the css code to the style sheet in the site's theme addon.

CDef.Name: RSS Feed Newsletter Issue Page Rules

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this rule. It is not required but can be helpful top locate this rule in a list.

Field.Name: rssfeedid
Field.Caption: RSS Feed
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this RSS Feed.

Field.Name: newsletterissuepageid
Field.Caption: Newsletter Story
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this rule only applies to this Newsletter Story.
